verses.devanagari:
पराशरं मुनिवरं कृतपूर्वाह्निकक्रियाम् ।
मैत्रेयः परिपप्रच्छ प्रणिपत्याभिवाद्य च ॥
verses.iast:
parāśaraṃ munivaraṃ kṛta-pūrvāhnika-kriyām
maitreyaḥ paripapraccha praṇipatyābhivādya ca
verses.translation: After completing his morning rites, the eminent sage Parāśara was respectfully approached and questioned by Maitreya.

verses.devanagari:
त्वत्तो हि वेदाध्ययनमधीतमखिलं गुरो ।
धर्मशास्त्राणि सर्वाणि वेदाङ्गानि यथाक्रमम् ॥
verses.iast:
tvatto hi vedādhyayanam adhītam akhilaṃ guro
dharmaśāstrāṇi sarvāṇi vedāṅgāni yathākramam
verses.translation: From you, O teacher, I have learned the Vedas, all the treatises on dharma, and the Vedic auxiliaries in due order.

verses.devanagari:
त्वत्प्रसादान् मुनिश्रेष्ठ मामन्ये नाकृतश्रमम् ।
वक्ष्यन्ति सर्वशास्त्रेषु प्रायशो येऽपि विद्विषः ॥
verses.iast:
tvatprasādān muniśreṣṭha mām anye nākṛtaśramam
vakṣyanti sarvaśāstreṣu prāyaśo ye ’pi vidviṣaḥ
verses.translation: By your grace, O foremost sage, even the ill-disposed will often acknowledge me as learned in the scriptures without undue toil.

verses.devanagari:
सोऽहमिच्छामि धर्मज्ञ श्रोतुं त्वत्तो यथा जगत् ।
बभूव भूयश्च यथा महाभाग भविष्यति ॥
verses.iast:
so ’ham icchāmi dharmajña śrotuṃ tvatto yathā jagat
babhūva bhūyaś ca yathā mahābhāga bhaviṣyati
verses.translation: Therefore I wish to hear from you, O knower of dharma, how the world arose, how it comes to be again, and how it will be.

verses.devanagari:
यन्मयं च जगद् ब्रह्मन् यतश्चैतच्चराचरम् ।
लीनमासीद्यथा यत्र लयमेष्यति यत्र च ॥
verses.iast:
yanmayaṃ ca jagad brahman yataś caitac carācaram
līnam āsīd yathā yatra layam eṣyati yatra ca
verses.translation: Of what the universe is composed, O brāhman; whence this moving and unmoving all; how and where it lay dissolved, and where it will return.

verses.devanagari:
यत्प्रमाणानि भूतानि देवादीनां च संभवम् ।
समुद्रपर्वतानां च संस्थानं च यथा भुवः ॥
verses.iast:
yatpramāṇāni bhūtāni devādīnāṃ ca saṃbhavam
samudraparvatānāṃ ca saṃsthānaṃ ca yathā bhuvaḥ
verses.translation: What the measures of beings are; the origin of gods and others; and the arrangement of oceans, mountains, and the earth.

verses.devanagari:
सूर्यादीनां च संस्थानं प्रमाणं मुनिसत्तम ।
देवादीनां तथा वंशान् मनून् मन्वन्तराणि च ॥
verses.iast:
sūryādīnāṃ ca saṃsthānaṃ pramāṇaṃ munisattama
devādīnāṃ tathā vaṃśān manūn manvantarāṇi ca
verses.translation: The structure and measure of the sun and the rest; the lineages of gods and others; the Manus and their cosmic periods.

verses.devanagari:
कल्पान् कल्पविकल्पांश्च चतुर्युगविकल्पितान् ।
कल्पान्तस्य स्वरूपं च युगधर्मांश्च कृत्स्नशः ॥
verses.iast:
kalpān kalpavikalpāṃś ca caturyugavikalpitān
kalpāntasya svarūpaṃ ca yugadharmāṃś ca kṛtsnaśaḥ
verses.translation: The aeons and their varieties patterned by the four yugas; the nature of a kalpa’s end and the duties proper to each age.

verses.devanagari:
देवर्षिपार्थिवानां च चरितं यन्महामुने ।
वेदशाखाप्रणयनं यथावद्व्यासकर्तृकम् ॥
verses.iast:
devarṣipārthivānāṃ ca caritaṃ yan mahāmune
vedaśākhāpraṇayanaṃ yathāvad vyāsakartṛkam
verses.translation: The deeds of gods, seers, and kings; and how the Vedic branches were properly arranged by Vyāsa.

verses.devanagari:
धर्मांश्च ब्राह्मणादीनां तथा चाश्रमवासिनाम् ।
श्रोतुमिच्छाम्यहं सर्वं त्वत्तो वासिष्ठनन्दन ॥
verses.iast:
dharmāṃś ca brāhmaṇādīnāṃ tathā cāśramavāsinām
śrotum icchāmy ahaṃ sarvaṃ tvatto vāsiṣṭhanandana
verses.translation: I wish to hear from you, O son of Vasiṣṭha, the duties of the social classes and of the dwellers in the stages of life.

verses.devanagari:
अविकाराय शुद्धाय नित्याय परात्मने ।
सदैकरूपरूपाय विष्णवे सर्वजिष्णवे ॥
verses.iast:
avikārāya śuddhāya nityāya paramātmane
sadaikarūparūpāya viṣṇave sarvajiṣṇave
verses.translation: Obeisance to Viṣṇu—the changeless, pure, eternal Supreme Self, ever of a single, constant form, the all-victorious.

verses.devanagari:
नमो हिरण्यगर्भाय हरये शङ्कराय च ।
वासुदेवाय ताराय सर्गस्थित्यन्तकारिणे ॥
verses.iast:
namo hiraṇyagarbhāya haraye śaṃkarāya ca
vāsudevāya tārāya sarga-sthiti-anta-kāriṇe
verses.translation: Homage to Hiraṇyagarbha, to Hari, to Śaṅkara; to Vāsudeva the savior, doer of creation, preservation, and dissolution.

verses.devanagari:
एकानेकस्वरूपाय स्थूलसूक्ष्मात्मने नमः ।
अव्यक्तव्यक्तरूपाय विष्णवे मुक्तिहेतवे ॥
verses.iast:
ekānekasvarūpāya sthūlasūkṣmātmane namaḥ
avyaktavyaktarūpāya viṣṇave muktihetave

word_by_word.english: whose nature is gross and subtle

verses.translation: Obeisance to Him of one-and-many forms, whose being is both gross and subtle; to Viṣṇu whose forms are unmanifest and manifest, the cause of liberation.

verses.devanagari:
सर्गस्थितिविनाशानां जगतो यो जगन्मयः ।
मूलभूतः नमस्तस्मै विष्णवे परमान्त्मने ॥
verses.iast:
sarga-sthiti-vināśānāṃ jagato yo jaganmayaḥ
mūlabhūtaḥ namas tasmai viṣṇave paramātmane
verses.translation: Homage to that Supreme Self Viṣṇu, the very root of the universe—who pervades all and is creation, maintenance, and dissolution.

verses.devanagari:
आधारभूतं विश्वस्याप्यणीयांसमणीयसाम् ।
प्रणम्य सर्वभूतस्थमच्युतं पुरुषोत्तमम् ॥
verses.iast:
ādhārabhūtaṃ viśvasyāpy aṇīyāṃsam aṇīyasām
praṇamya sarvabhūtastham acyutaṃ puruṣottamam
verses.translation: I bow to Acyuta, the Supreme Person—support of the universe, subtler than the subtlest, abiding in all beings.

verses.devanagari:
ज्ञानस्वरूपमत्यन्तनिर्मलं परमार्थतः ।
तमेवार्थस्वरूपेण भ्रान्तिदर्शनतः स्थितम् ॥
verses.iast:
jñānasvarūpam atyanta-nirmalaṃ paramārthataḥ
tamevārthasvarūpeṇa bhrāntidarśanataḥ sthitam
verses.translation: In ultimate truth His essence is knowledge, utterly pure—yet, through deluded vision, He is taken as identified with objects.

verses.devanagari:
विष्णुं ग्रसिष्णुं विश्वस्य स्थितिसर्गे तथा प्रभुम् ।
प्रणम्य जगताम् ईशम् अजम् अक्षयम् अव्ययम् ॥
verses.iast:
viṣṇuṃ grasiṣṇuṃ viśvasya sthiti-sarge tathā prabhum
praṇamya jagatām īśam ajam akṣayam avyayam
verses.translation: Bowing to Viṣṇu—the Lord who absorbs the universe and is its preserver and creator—the unborn, undecaying, imperishable ruler of worlds.

verses.devanagari:
कथयामि यथापूर्वं दक्षाद्यैर् मुनिसत्तमैः ।
पृष्टः प्रोवाच भगवान् अब्जयोनिः पितामहः ॥
verses.iast:
kathayāmi yathāpūrvaṃ dakṣādyair munisattamaiḥ
pṛṣṭaḥ provāca bhagavān abjayoniḥ pitāmahaḥ
verses.translation: I shall narrate as before what the lotus-born Grandsire declared when questioned by Dakṣa and the foremost sages.

verses.devanagari:
तैश्चोक्तं पुरुकुत्साय भूभुजे नर्मदातटे ।
सारस्वताय तेनापि मम सारस्वतेन च ॥
verses.iast:
taiś coktaṃ purukutsāya bhūbhuje narmadātaṭe
sārasvatāya tenāpi mama sārasvatena ca
verses.translation: By them it was told to King Purukutsa on the bank of the Narmadā—then to Sārasvata, and by Sārasvata to me.

verses.devanagari:
परः पराणां परमः परमार्थ्मात्मसंस्थितः ।
रूपवर्णादि-निर्देश-विशेषण-विवर्जितः ॥
verses.iast:
paraḥ parāṇāṃ paramaḥ paramātmātmasaṃsthitaḥ
rūpavarṇādi-nirdeśa-viśeṣaṇa-vivarjitaḥ
verses.translation: The Supreme beyond all, abiding as the Paramātman—devoid of determinations such as form, color, and the rest.

verses.iast:
nirguṇasyāprameyasya śuddhasyāpy amalātmanaḥ |
kathaṃ sargādikartṛtvaṃ brahmaṇo ’bhyupagamyate ||
verses.translation: How is the authorship of creation and the like attributed to Brahman, who is without qualities, immeasurable, pure and stainless?

verses.iast:
śaktayaḥ sarvabhāvānām acintyajñānagocarāḥ |
yato ’to brahmaṇas tās tu sargādyā bhāvaśaktayaḥ |
bhavanti tapatāṃ śreṣṭha pāvakasya yathoṣṇatā ||
verses.translation: The powers of all entities—beyond thought yet knowable—proceed from Brahman; the creative power and others arise, O best of ascetics, as heat from fire.

verses.iast:
tan nibodha yathā sarge bhagavān saṃpravartate |
nārāyaṇākhyo bhagavān brahmā lokapitāmahaḥ ||
verses.translation: Learn how the Blessed One sets creation in motion—Brahmā, known as Nārāyaṇa, grandsire of the worlds.

verses.iast: utpannaḥ procyate vidvan nitya evopacārataḥ ||
verses.translation: He is said to be ‘born’, learned one, only in conventional speech; in truth He is eternal.

verses.iast:
nijena tasya mānena āyur varṣaśataṃ smṛtam |
tat parākhyaṃ tadardhaṃ ca parārdham abhidhīyate ||
verses.translation: By His own measure a hundred years is reckoned Brahmā’s life; the whole is called ‘Parā’, and its half ‘Parārdha’.

verses.iast:
kālasvarūpaṃ viṣṇoś ca yan mayoktaṃ tavānagha |
 tena tasya nibodha tvaṃ parimāṇopapādanam ||
verses.translation: Time is a form of Viṣṇu, as I told you, O sinless one—by that, understand the derivation of measures.

verses.iast:
anyeṣāṃ caiva jantūnāṃ carāṇām acarāś ca ye |
bhūbhūbhṛtsāgarādīnām aśeṣāṇāṃ ca sattama ||
verses.translation: Likewise for all beings—moving and unmoving—and for earth, mountains, oceans, and all else, O best of sages.

verses.iast:
nimeṣaḥ kāṣṭhā triṃśat syāt kāṣṭhāḥ kalāstrayaḥ smṛtāḥ |
kalātriṃśanmuhūrtaḥ syād iti kālavyavasthitiḥ ||
verses.translation: A nimeṣa is an instant; thirty nimeṣas make a kāṣṭhā; thirty kāṣṭhās a kalā; thirty kalās a muhūrta—thus time is reckoned.

verses.iast:
muhūrtair ahorātraṃ mānuṣaṃ parimīyate |
ahorātrāṇi tāvanti māsaḥ pakṣadvayātmakaḥ ||
verses.translation: By that measure, a human day and night is made of muhūrtas; that many day-nights make a month of two fortnights.

verses.iast:
ṣaḍbhir māsaistu cāyanaṃ dve ’yane dakṣiṇottare |
ayanaṃ dakṣiṇaṃ rātrir devānām uttaraṃ dinam ||
verses.translation: Six months make an ayana; the two are the southern and northern courses. The southern ayana is the night of the gods; the northern, their day.
